ngiemboon: Akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gẅiin yé kème njÿó, ayɛ̌ kɔ́ wɔ́ɔ tóo ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ pɔ́ na yé fʉ̀ʼ.
en: There is an occasion for everything,

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼ gie mé zyé múɔ áa wó,
en: a time to give birth and a time to die;

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼʉ lézẅé nyìŋ áa wó,
en: a time to kill and a time to heal;

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼʉ lélʉa áa wó,
en: a time to weep and a time to laugh;

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼʉ lémaʼ metǒon áa wó,
en: a time to throw stones and a time to gather stones;

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼʉ léfaʼ ńgẅiin áa wó,
en: a time to search and a time to count as lost;

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼʉ léshʉate menzsǒ áa wó,
en: a time to tear and a time to sew;

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼʉ lékwoŋo nyìŋ áa wó,
en: a time to love and a time to hate;

ngiemboon: Apì gie ngàŋafàʼ jÿó na ngɔ́ʼ gie à gyá na fàʼ, áa páʼɔɔn ńgwɔ́ kɔ́?
en: What does the worker gain from his struggles?

ngiemboon: N da sáŋa nò na mefàʼ mie Ssé la záb páʼ pʉ̀a mesoŋ ge faʼ.
en: I have seen the task that God has given the children of Adam to keep them occupied.

ngiemboon: À la gʉa na kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ, ńzába yé fʉ̀ʼ gie á ge gÿo pumte, à la gíŋ ńgÿo légwɔ́ gie ngwɔ́ nyìŋ tsɔ́ɔn lézsé mmó gie á lǎ cʉa, mbɔɔ gie á ge gÿo tá tó, táʼ pɔ́ ké te kuʼu lézsé kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gie Ssé la gÿo wɔ́.
en: He has made everything appropriate   in its time.  # 3:11 Gn 1:31 He has also put eternity in their hearts,  # 3:11 Or has put a sense of past and future into their minds, or has placed ignorance in their hearts but no one can discover the work God has done from beginning to end.  # 3:11 Jb 5:9; Ec 7:23; 8:17; Rm 11:33

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá n cʉ́me ńgɔɔn ngie, anò mbòŋo ye nyìŋ mesoŋ gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndàʼ yé lénéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ lekág, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo yé léjúʼ mboŋó na melyɛ̌ʼ láʼ mie à ge lɔg néŋe ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ.
en: I know that there is nothing better for them than to rejoice and enjoy the   good life.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, e Ssé zɔ̌ gÿo tá nyìŋ gẅiin mmó mpfɛ̌ pɔ́ ye nǔ, ḿbiŋ ńjúʼ mboŋó ńzẅɛ́ʼɛ mefàʼ mé.
en: It is also the gift of God whenever anyone eats, drinks, and enjoys all his efforts.

ngiemboon: N zsě ngie akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gie Ssé la gÿo, á ge láʼa gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó. Atsɔ́ gie ngwɔ́ mé kẅiʼi mǒ te wó wɔ́, atsɔ́ gie ngwɔ́ mé piŋ ńtsẅɛ́te mǒ ké te wó wɔ́. E Ssé gÿo púʼu, légwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a mesoŋ ge pɔ́gɔ yé.
en: I know that everything God does will last forever; there is no adding to it or taking from it.   God works so that people will be in awe of him.  # 3:14 Ex 7:5; Ezk 36:23

ngiemboon: Ammó gie áa wó, áa gie á la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wó, ammó gie á ge gÿo tá tó, à gwɔ́ gie á lǎ zɔɔn ńcʉa, e Ssé gʉa fwɔʼɔ gie á la gʉa ńdyeen.
en: Whatever is, has already been,   and whatever will be, already is. However, God seeks justice for the persecuted.  # 3:15 Lit God seeks what is pursued

ngiemboon: N da gíŋ ńgyá tsɔ́ mmó ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ: efʉ̌ʼnò léen ńjÿó jʉʼ gie mé ké ńgẅiin létÿɔ́gɔ kwò na lepʉ̌ wó, efʉ̌ʼnò jÿó jʉʼ gie mé ké ńgẅiin léshwóŋo nò wó pɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ.
en: I also observed under the sun: there is wickedness at the place of judgment and there is wickedness at the place of righteousness.

ngiemboon: E sele ńgɔɔn né twó mbùm yɔ́ɔn ngie, e Ssé ge gÿo ŋaga nyìŋ gẅie aa ngàŋa nò nénʉ́ mbɔɔ ngàŋa fʉ̌ʼnò, á nue akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gẅiin yé kème njÿó, e Ssé ge gÿo ŋaga wégè na ngÿǒ menò mégè pɔ́ ntsèm.
en: I said to myself, “God will judge the righteous and the wicked,   since there is a time for every activity and every work.”  # 3:17 Ec 3:1

ngiemboon: Á la gʉa na nò pʉ̀a mesoŋ, n gɔɔn na twó mbùm yɔ́ɔn ngie e Ssé kwoŋo lélʉŋte wɔ́b, légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge gyá ngie pɔ́ té cʉa menɔ̀ɔn né tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: I said to myself, “This happens so that God may test the children of Adam and they may see for themselves that they are like animals.”

ngiemboon: Á nue ammó gie á ne ńzẅíʼte pʉ̀a mesoŋ, á gíŋ ńgwɔ́ gie á zẅíʼte menɔ̀ɔn. Azẅìge légwɔ́ wó gwɔ́ pɔ́ tàʼa mmó na pʉ̀a mesoŋ mbɔɔ na menɔ̀ɔn, epʉ̀a mesoŋ ge gÿo kwéte, menɔ̀ɔn gíŋ ńkwéte yɔ́b. Epʉ̀a mesoŋ té gẅiin tsɔ́ mmó gie pɔ́ lɔg ńcʉa menɔ̀ɔn wɔ́, á nue pɔ́ metsèm mag pɔ́ páʼ melɔ́ɔn.
en: For the fate of the children of Adam and the fate of animals is the same.   As one dies, so dies the other; they all have the same breath. People have no advantage over animals since everything is futile.

ngiemboon: Akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á zẅíge wɔ́ɔ, à ge gÿo gʉa pɔ́ lé tàʼa jʉʼ, mé la lɔg pɔ́ tsetsáʼ ḿbwóon wɔ́b, pɔ́ ge gÿo sele cʉ́ʼʉ tsetsáʼ.
en: All are going to the same place; all come from dust, and all return to dust.

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ wɔ́ zsé kà zẅìge gie á gÿo nyìŋ mesoŋ gwɔ́ wó, á kwɔ́ʼ ńgʉa lé tÿǒ, aye menɔ̀ɔn piŋ ésẅɛ́ʼ lé nzèm ssé tsetsáʼ?
en: Who knows if the spirits of the children of Adam go upward and the spirits of animals go downward to the earth?

ngiemboon: N da gyá ngie atsɔ́ nò mbòŋo té wó mbwó nyìŋ mesoŋ tà ńtɔ́gɔ yé léjúʼ mboŋó ńzẅɛ́ʼɛ mefàʼ mé wɔ́, yɛ̌ zɔɔ yé mmó gie ngwɔ́ á lɔg ńkág, á nue tsɔ̌ nyìŋ te wó gẅie à ge gÿo lɔgɔ yé é gíŋ piŋ nzèm, à gyá mmó gie á ka cʉ́ʼ nzèm ńcʉa wɔ́.
en: I have seen that there is nothing better than for a person to enjoy his activities   because that is his reward. For who can enable him to see what will happen after he dies?  # 3:22 Lit after him,# 3:22 Ec 2:18; 6:12; 8:7; 10:14
